item.title: Google+
item.dc:creator: Rukia
item.description:
The g+ language depends on the google language in general, so if google.com is in english, g+ is english as well.
I’m not sure what i should think about google plus in general. Editing your profile and changing the privacy settings for your profile is imo much easier than on facebook. But I’m not sure if I can trust google more than facebook.

Anyway, I could invite you guys as well - pm me your email address

Read full topic

item.title: Google+
item.dc:creator: TheSuperNova
item.description:
Meh, I’ll stick with Facebook until it goes public, that way if all my friends decide to sign up, I may as well too, but as of yet none of my friends have bothered.

Read full topic

item.title: Google+
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
I’m not sure, it’s very much like Facebook which doesn’t make it that interesting. “Circles” is the only thing that - to me - makes it maybe better than Facebook, as it makes it easy to separate people, but it’s also a bit confusing.

If Google wants to make people switch from Facebook, they not only have to make something slightly better, but rather something so much better that it compensates for having to get your >300 friends to switch, too. And that’s going to be tough.

Read full topic

I don’t know, but i hope it does.

item.title: Google+
item.dc:creator: Veritas
item.description:
Tei:

Google+ kind of freaks me out. i don’t wear tinfoil hats or anything but the idea of one organization having this much information on me as a person just scares me. With GMail, Google Search, Google+ and all these other services combined, Google literally knows me better than most people.

Google knows who my friends are and what peoples i associate with. Google knows my address, my phone number and even my work contacts. Google knows what values i keep. Google knows what kind of perverted interests i have. Google knows what kind of porn i like. Google knows what movies i pirate. Google knows my iP address. Google knows what guns i own. Google knows the hooker i’ve been seeing. Google knows the phone number for the guy i buy weed from. if i post it online, Google knows it. Google knows me. Google knows my friends. Google knows my family.

…and i don’t know SHiT about Google.

Yes, it’s an exaggeration if they really wanted to, someone at Google could really screw with me. i -like lots of people- prefer to keep their online personalities separate from their real-world selves. i’m a whole different person depending on where i am. My co-workers see one “me”, my family another “me” and online acquaintances see another “me”. i don’t like to mix them together and no “circle” will allow me to do that without giving up my name(s) and alias(es) to everybody.

i’ve gotten a few invites and i’m still feeling kind of iffy about signing up.

-Kawai Tei-

Why would you post this stuff on the internet, or in that case, do it at all. If you don’t want them to know this stuff don’t post it, that simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Google+
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
So what if they have all of your personal informations? I’m sorry to say this, but don’t think too high of yourself. I seriously doubt anyone at Google gives a fuck about anybody here. Why would they?

Read full topic

item.title: Google+
item.dc:creator: Veritas
item.description:
I have a facebook and I guess I can see the benefits of changing over, seeing as facebook has had so many privacy/security issues in the past. I received an invite yesterday, and its nothing spectacular, seems pretty boring to me. It has a lot of potential for growth, but it seems like something new for hipsters to brag about e.g. “I was on Google+ before it was cool”. It’ll probably just go the way of Google wave imo.

Read full topic
